dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, we've got some pretty big news in the world of campaign finance this week, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, we've got some pretty big news in the world of campaign finance this week, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. This is, um, kind of a landmark moment, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. This is, um, kind of a landmark moment, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's about a dark money group, Americans for Job Security, or AJS. And, like, for the first time since Citizens United, they've actually been forced to disclose their donors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's about a dark money group, Americans for Job Security, or A J S. And, like, for the first time since Citizens United, they've actually been forced to disclose their donors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first time in the Citizens United-era that a dark money group was forced to disclose their donors in a certain time period, said Jordan Libowitz, a spokesperson for nonprofit watchdog group Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington, referring to the 2010 Supreme Court case that wiped away previous restrictions on political spending.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is huge, because, you know, the whole point of Citizens United was, uh, it kinda bolstered anonymity for these types of organizations. They've been fighting this for *years*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is huge, because, you know, the whole point of Citizens United was, uh, it kinda bolstered anonymity for these types of organizations. They've been fighting this for years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But after years of litigation, CREW convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. CREW, the watchdog group, they really went after them. And the FEC finally agreed. So, who did they find?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. C R E W, the watchdog group, they really went after them. And the F E C finally agreed. So, who did they find?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But after years of litigation, CREW convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the names are, like, pretty big. Charles Schwab, the brokerage titan? He dropped almost nine million dollars, uh, in just three months back in 2012.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the names are, like, pretty big. Charles Schwab, the brokerage titan? He dropped almost nine million dollars, uh, in just three months back in twenty twelve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest individual donor to the group appears to be Charles Schwab, the brokerage titan worth an estimated $7.8 billion. Over the span of three months in 2012, he donated nearly $9 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. [interrupts] Nine million! And that's just one guy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Nine million! And that's just one guy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then you've got Doris Fisher, the Gap co-founder, and her sons. They gave another nine million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then you've got Doris Fisher, the Gap co-founder, and her sons. They gave another nine million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gap cofounder Doris Fisheralong with her sons Robert, John and Williamgave another $9 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we're talking about some serious, uh, serious money flowing into this group. What about other notable names?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we're talking about some serious, uh, serious money flowing into this group. What about other notable names?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, tons of billionaires. The DeVos family, Richard Kinder, the Wilks brothers, Robert McNair â€“ all big Republican donors. And, um, companies too, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, tons of billionaires. The DeVos family, Richard Kinder, the Wilks brothers, Robert McNair - all big Republican donors. And, um, companies too, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The late Republican megadonors Richard and Helen DeVos gave $1 million to the group in October 2012. Texas oil-and-gas billionaires Richard Kinder, Dan Wilks, Farris Wilks and late Houston Texans owner Robert McNair were also among the donors that year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like Wynn Resorts gave half a million, and Bass Pro Shops chipped in fifty grand. So, not just individuals, but corporations too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like Wynn Resorts gave half a million, and Bass Pro Shops chipped in fifty grand. So, not just individuals, but corporations too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wynn Resorts contributed $500,000 and Bass Pro Shops contributed $50,000 in 2012.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fascinating. So, after all these years of saying, "Nah, we don't have to tell you," they finally had to spill the beans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fascinating. So, after all these years of saying, Nah, we don't have to tell you, they finally had to spill the beans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Americans for Job Security had previously claimed it was not a political organization and therefore did not have to disclose its donors. But after years of litigation, CREW convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and, uh, it really just shows the sheer scale of wealth that was backing these anonymous political efforts. Pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and, uh, it really just shows the sheer scale of wealth that was backing these anonymous political efforts. Pretty wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely sheds a light on what's been happening behind the scenes, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely sheds a light on what's been happening behind the scenes, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And it sets a precedent, I think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And it sets a precedent, I think.
